audit.name: Password History
audit.description: Password History is the number of passwords Windows NT will remember so that users cannot use the same password twice. It is recommended that you set the history length to 24. Note: Linux/Unix based systems running Samba are also affected by this notification.
audit.fixInformation:
For Windows:
Set the Password History to 24 or appropriate value:
  • Open the Group Policy Editor.
  • Within Computer Configuration policy, navigate to Windows Settings > Security Settings > Account Policies > Password Policy.
  • Double-click on the setting named "Enforce password history" to edit the Properties.
  • Enter the amount of passwords to be remembered (Recommended 24 or greater).


    • For Samba:
    Samba implementations vary depending on operating system. However, a generalized guide on configuring Samba can be found at:
    http://dp.samba.org/samba/docs/man/Samba-HOWTO-Collection/

audit.name: User Never Logged On
audit.description: It is suggested that you review this user account. If it is not needed or was not created by an administrator of your network, it is suggested that you disable or delete it.
audit.fixInformation:
To delete the account

For Windows:
  • 1. Open User Manager
  • 2. Select the account to delete
  • 3. Press the "Delete" key
  • 4. Click "Ok"
To disable the account (non-built-in accounts only):
  • 1. Open User Manager
  • 2. Select the account to disable
  • 3. Select Properties from the User menu
  • 4. Check "Account Disabled"
  • 5. Click "Ok"
For Samba:

Samba implementations vary depending on operating system. However, a generalized guide on configuring Samba can be found at: http://dp.samba.org/samba/docs/man/Samba-HOWTO-Collection/

audit.name: SSH Local Access Not Available
audit.description: Retina was unable to login to the remote system via SSH.
audit.fixInformation: Please verify your login credentials are correct.

audit.name: FTP Server Detected
audit.description: A FTP (File Transfer Protocol) server is listening on this port.
audit.fixInformation:
When using FTP, data such as usernames and passwords are transferred in cleartext by default. Attackers may be able to eavesdrop on a FTP session and obtain credentials.

If possible, switch to SFTP (SSH File Transfer Protocol) or FTPS (FTP Over SSL/TLS) instead. If switching to a secure protocol is not possible in your environment, restrict access to the FTP service as much as possible so that only specifically authorized IP addresses can utilize it.

audit.name: HTTP 1.1 Protocol Detected
audit.description: This is an informational check. Retina has detected version 1.1 of the HTTP Protocol on the target system.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Retina has detected version 1.1 of the HTTP Protocol on the target system.

audit.name: HTTP 1.1 Protocol Detected
audit.description: This is an informational check. Retina has detected version 1.1 of the HTTP Protocol on the target system.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Retina has detected version 1.1 of the HTTP Protocol on the target system.

audit.name: HTTP Gzip Compression Detected
audit.description: Retina has detected that the targeted system allows gzip content encoding.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Retina has detected that the targeted system allows gzip content encoding.

audit.name: HTTP Gzip Compression Detected
audit.description: Retina has detected that the targeted system allows gzip content encoding.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Retina has detected that the targeted system allows gzip content encoding.

audit.name: SSL Certificate Public Key Algorithm
audit.description: This is an informational check. Retina has detected the certificate's public key algorithm.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Ensure the certificate is using an accepted public key algorithm.

audit.name: SSL Certificate Public Key Algorithm
audit.description: This is an informational check. Retina has detected the certificate's public key algorithm.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Ensure the certificate is using an accepted public key algorithm.
audit.context: TCP:443 (COMODO RSA Organization Validation Secure Server CA) [[]Chain]

audit.name: SSL Certificate Public Key Algorithm
audit.description: This is an informational check. Retina has detected the certificate's public key algorithm.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Ensure the certificate is using an accepted public key algorithm.

audit.name: SSL Certificate Version
audit.description: This is an informational check. Retina has detected the certificate's version.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Ensure the certificate is using an acceptable version.

audit.name: SSL Certificate Version
audit.description: This is an informational check. Retina has detected the certificate's version.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Ensure the certificate is using an acceptable version.
audit.context: TCP:443 (COMODO RSA Organization Validation Secure Server CA) [[]Chain]

audit.name: SSL Certificate Version
audit.description: This is an informational check. Retina has detected the certificate's version.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. Ensure the certificate is using an acceptable version.

audit.name: Samba SID Parsing Buffer Overflow
audit.description:
Samba contains a stack-based buffer overflow when parsing crafted, client-supplied file share SIDs. Successful exploitation could allow execution of arbitrary code or could cause a denial of service.

Note: This audit may report false findings on systems running backported versions of Samba.
audit.fixInformation: Upgrade Samba to version 3.5.5, 3.4.9, 3.3.14, or newer; or install updated packages from appropriate vendor.

audit.name: Samba FD_SET Stack Corruption Denial of Service
audit.description: Samba contains a vulnerability in the FD_SET macro when handling file descriptors. Attackers that are able to establish a connection to a file share could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt stack memory and thus cause a denial of service condition.
audit.fixInformation: Upgrade Samba to version 3.3.15, 3.4.12, 3.5.7, or newer; or install updated packages from appropriate vendor.

audit.name: Samba Multiple Vulnerabilities (20120410)
audit.description: Samba contains a vulnerability when handling crafted RPC calls. Successful exploitation could allow unauthenticated attackers to remotely execute arbitrary code as root.
audit.fixInformation: Upgrade Samba to version 3.6.4, 3.5.14, 3.4.16, or newer.

audit.name: Samba Remote Security Bypass (20120430)
audit.description: Samba contains a vulnerability when handling certain LSA RPC procedures (i.e. CreateAccount, OpenAccount, AddAccountRights, and RemoveAccountRights). Successful exploitation could allow authenticated attackers to grant themselves the "take ownership" privilege on arbitrary files and directories.
audit.fixInformation: Upgrade Samba to version 3.6.5, 3.5.15, 3.4.17, or newer.

audit.name: Web Server Default Install Page Detected - Apache
audit.description: Retina has detected a web server's default install page.
audit.fixInformation: Configure the web server or disable if not needed.

audit.name: NetBIOS/SMB Information Disclosure
audit.description: Retina has detected a target running a SMB service which responds to SMB requests with potentially sensitive information about the network.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check.

audit.name: SMTP Server Detected
audit.description: A SMTP server is listening on this port.
audit.fixInformation: SMTP servers are often targeted by spammers and phishers and should be disabled if they are not being used. If they are being used, consider filtering incoming traffic to this port.

audit.name: SMB/CIFS Server Detected
audit.description: Retina has detected a Server Message Block (SMB) or Common Internet File System (CIFS) protocol server. This service is used to allow access to shared files/printers on a network.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. No action is required.

audit.name: SMB/CIFS Server Detected
audit.description: Retina has detected a Server Message Block (SMB) or Common Internet File System (CIFS) protocol server. This service is used to allow access to shared files/printers on a network.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. No action is required.

audit.name: VSFTP Denial of Service
audit.description: VSFTP server before 2.3.3 is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to crash the affected application, denying service to legitimate users. Note: this is a remote, unauthenticated check which may cause false positives with vendor specific backported versions. Ensure that the system is properly patched.
audit.fixInformation: Upgrade to VSFTP 2.3.3 or later.

audit.name: Samba Server Detected
audit.description: Retina has detected an instance of a UNIX / Linux Samba server.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check.

audit.name: Samba Multiple Vulnerabilities (20131213) - Remote
audit.description: Samba contains multiple vulnerabilities including: a bypass vulnerability within 'winbind_name_list_to_sid_string_list()' which may be exploited by a remote attacker to access configuration files, a buffer overflow within 'dcerpc_read_ncacn_packet_done' which may be exploited via a crafted fragment length to possibly execute arbitrary code. Note - this is a remote, unauthenticated check and may cause false positives.
audit.fixInformation: Update Samba to versions 4.1.3, 4.0.13, 3.6.22, or newer.

audit.name: Apache Default Page Detected
audit.description: Retina has detected the default Apache page in the webroot of the server. This may be an indication of a misconfigured web server.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check.

audit.name: SSL/TLS Cipher Suites Supported
audit.description: The remote host was found to support the following set of SSL/TLS ciphers for encrypting communications.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. No action is necessary.

audit.name: SSL/TLS Cipher Block Chaining Cipher Suites Supported
audit.description: The remote host supports Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode SSL/TLS ciphers. These ciphers are more secure than Electronic Codebook (ECB) mode ciphers but can lead to information disclosure if used improperly.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. No action is required.

audit.name: SSL/TLS Versions Supported
audit.description: This finding detects which SSL and TLS protocol versions are supported by the remote service for encrypting communications.
audit.fixInformation: This is an informational check. No action is required.

audit.name: Samba 3.0.0 < 4.3.3 Multiple Vulnerabilities
audit.description: Samba contains multiple vulnerabilities that can allow remote attackers to launch a denial of service attack, access files, mount a man-in-the-middle attack, and read memory. Note - this is a remote, unauthenticated check and may produce false positives.
audit.fixInformation: Update to Samba version 4.3.3 or later.
